Description: Low conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black in bottom of bowl with reserved dot at centre; exterior: glazed black; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '35', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 35)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1086) (phase 2)
